trans-unit.source: Connect to SQL Database by using Python with pymssql on Ubuntu
trans-unit.target: Connect to SQL Database by using Python with pymssql on Ubuntu

trans-unit.source: Presents a Python code sample you can use to connect to Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Presents a Python code sample you can use to connect to Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: The sample runs on an Ubuntu Linux client computer.
trans-unit.target: The sample runs on an Ubuntu Linux client computer.

trans-unit.source: Connect to SQL Database by using Python on Ubuntu Linux
trans-unit.target: Connect to SQL Database by using Python on Ubuntu Linux

trans-unit.source: This topic presents a Python code sample that run on an Ubuntu Linux client computer, to connect to an Azure SQL Database database.
trans-unit.target: This topic presents a Python code sample that run on an Ubuntu Linux client computer, to connect to an Azure SQL Database database.

trans-unit.source: Requirements
trans-unit.target: Requirements

trans-unit.source: [Python 2.7.6](https://www.python.org/download/releases/2.7.6/).
trans-unit.target: [Python 2.7.6](https://www.python.org/download/releases/2.7.6/).

trans-unit.source: Install the required modules
trans-unit.target: Install the required modules

trans-unit.source: Open your terminal and navigate to a directory where you plan on creating your python script.
trans-unit.target: Open your terminal and navigate to a directory where you plan on creating your python script.

trans-unit.source: Enter the following commands to install **FreeTDS** and **pymssql**.
trans-unit.target: Enter the following commands to install **FreeTDS** and **pymssql**.

trans-unit.source: pymssql uses FreeTDS to connect to SQL Databases.
trans-unit.target: pymssql uses FreeTDS to connect to SQL Databases.

trans-unit.source: Create a database and retrieve your connection string
trans-unit.target: Create a database and retrieve your connection string

trans-unit.source: See the [getting started page](sql-database-get-started.md) to learn how to create a sample database and get your connection string.
trans-unit.target: See the [getting started page](sql-database-get-started.md) to learn how to create a sample database and get your connection string.

trans-unit.source: It is important you follow the guide to create an **AdventureWorks database template**.
trans-unit.target: It is important you follow the guide to create an **AdventureWorks database template**.

trans-unit.source: The samples shown below only work with the **AdventureWorks schema**.
trans-unit.target: The samples shown below only work with the **AdventureWorks schema**.

trans-unit.source: Connect to your SQL Database
trans-unit.target: Connect to your SQL Database

trans-unit.source: The [pymssql.connect](http://pymssql.org/en/latest/ref/pymssql.html) function is used to connect to SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: The [pymssql.connect](http://pymssql.org/en/latest/ref/pymssql.html) function is used to connect to SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: Execute an SQL SELECT statement
trans-unit.target: Execute an SQL SELECT statement

trans-unit.source: The [cursor.execute](http://pymssql.org/en/latest/ref/pymssql.html#pymssql.Cursor.execute) function can be used to retrieve a result set from a query against SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: The [cursor.execute](http://pymssql.org/en/latest/ref/pymssql.html#pymssql.Cursor.execute) function can be used to retrieve a result set from a query against SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: This function essentially accepts any query and returns a result set which can be iterated over with the use of [cursor.fetchone()](http://pymssql.org/en/latest/ref/pymssql.html#pymssql.Cursor.fetchone).
trans-unit.target: This function essentially accepts any query and returns a result set which can be iterated over with the use of [cursor.fetchone()](http://pymssql.org/en/latest/ref/pymssql.html#pymssql.Cursor.fetchone).

trans-unit.source: Insert a row, pass parameters, and retrieve the generated primary key
trans-unit.target: Insert a row, pass parameters, and retrieve the generated primary key

trans-unit.source: In SQL Database the [IDENTITY](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms186775.aspx) property and the [SEQUENECE](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ff878058.aspx) object can be used to auto-generate [primary key](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms179610.aspx) values.
trans-unit.target: In SQL Database the [IDENTITY](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms186775.aspx) property and the [SEQUENECE](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ff878058.aspx) object can be used to auto-generate [primary key](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms179610.aspx) values.

trans-unit.source: Transactions
trans-unit.target: Transactions

trans-unit.source: This code example demonstrates the use of transactions in which you:
trans-unit.target: This code example demonstrates the use of transactions in which you:

trans-unit.source: -Begin a transaction
trans-unit.target: -Begin a transaction

trans-unit.source: -Insert a row of data
trans-unit.target: -Insert a row of data

trans-unit.source: -Rollback your transaction to undo the insert
trans-unit.target: -Rollback your transaction to undo the insert
